title: Cattle population worldwide 2012 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Cattle population in million head, with a total of 8 data points. The chart has 3 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2019 to 2015.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2014 to 2012.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2014.
gold: How many cattle are in the world ? The global cattle population amounted to about 996.36 million head in 2018 , down from over one billion cattle in 2014 . Cows as livestock The domestication of cattle began as early as 10,000 to 5,000 years ago . From ancient times up to the present , cattle are bred to provide meat and dairy .
